title: Tapenade Baked Chicken and Mashed Potatoes with Caramelized Onions

ingredients.content: 2 anchovy fillets, preserved in salt rinsed with water to remove salt
1 - 2 pinches ground black pepper, to taste
2 - 3 sprigs fresh rosemary, leaves only, to taste
½ tsp meat stock paste, homemade

preparations.content: Place garlic clove in mixing bowl and chop <b>3 sec/speed 8<b>.
Add black olives, capers, lemon juice, anchovy fillets, thyme, salt and black pepper then chop <b>10 sec/speed 4.5<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add olive oil and mix <b>10 sec/speed 4.5<b>. Transfer to a bowl and set aside. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Place garlic cloves, rosemary, lemon, preferably organic, salt and black pepper in mixing bowl then chop <b>5 sec/speed 7<b>. Transfer to a bowl and set aside. Clean mixing bowl.

Gently slide fingers under skin from back of the chicken to the front, to loosen skin (be careful not to tear it). Using a butter knife, loosen the skin at the front of the chicken. Add reserved tapenade with a teaspoon between loosened skin and chicken breast. Press the skin with your fingers to spread the tapenade from the back to the front of the chicken. Stuff the chicken with its filling and bundle the chicken legs together with a kitchen string. Season skin with salt, black pepper and paprika. Then place the prepared chicken in a casserole dish and add chicken stock to it. Bake for 1 hour (180°C), then increase oven temperature to 200°C and bake a further 30 minutes. After the first 30 minutes baking time, start with the peeling of the potatoes and continue with preparation of the mashed potatoes.
